intro: Elephantopus colimensis, commonly known as the common elephantopus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated, lobed leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
